metadata.title: Math Kangaroo
tags: Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science (WMiI)

page_content:
The Beaver competition (link: http://www.bobr.edu.pl/) is an international competition in computer science and information and communication technology established in 2004 in Lithuania.
The rules of the contest are similar to those of the very popular Kangaroo math contest in schools. The contest covers students in all types of schools and has already been organized in many countries. The competition is organized by the Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science of the Nicolaus Copernicus University and the Vulcan company.

metadata.title: Bóbr computer competition
tags: Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science (WMiI)

page_content:
Józef Marcinkiewicz competition for the best student paper in mathematics.
The competition is organized by the Toruń Branch of PTM (link: http://www.ptm.org.pl/).

metadata.title: Jozef Marcinkiewicz competition
tags: Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science (WMiI)

page_content:
The goal of the competition is to stimulate and develop mathematical interests among elementary school students. The organizers, through the students, saw in the long run the activation of the community of mathematics teachers to work with young people interested in learning about mathematics.
Task League (link: http://liga.mat.umk.pl/)

metadata.title: Task League
tags: Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science (WMiI)

page_content:
The Regional Mathematics Circle (link: https://www.mat.umk.pl/web/rkm/regionalne-kolo-matematyczne) is designed for high school students.

In 2007-2009, the classes were financed by own funds and MEN grants. In the 2009/10 school year, the classes are financed under the OP HC.

metadata.title: Regional Math Circle
tags: Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science (WMiI)

page_content:
The WMiI Computer Science Competition (link: https://www.mat.umk.pl/konkurs-informatyczny) is designed for high school students.

The competition tasks are algorithmic in nature. To solve them, knowledge of Internet technologies and modern programming tools such as *Java* or *PHP* is required.

The competition has been organized since 1990 (since 2000 in a changed formula) and is the oldest IT competition in Poland.
Attention. Currently, the IT Competition is not organized.

metadata.title: WMiI Computer Science Competition
